description: Twitter have disabled a George Floyd tribute video, posted by US President Donald Trump’ s campaign, on its platform, citing a copyright complaint, in the latest clash between the leader and the social media platform.
text:
Twitter have disabled a George Floyd tribute video, posted by US President
Donald Trump's campaign, on its platform, citing a copyright complaint, in the
latest clash between the leader and the social media platform.The clip
features Mr Trump speaking, with an overlay of photos and videos of protest
marches and instances of violence that have occurred in the aftermath of the
36-year-old's death at the hands of a white police officer in Minneapolis,
Minnesota, last week.In widely-circulated footage,former police officer Derek
ChauvinTwitter said the video on the President's campaign Twitter account,
retweeted by both the President personally and his son, was affected by its
copyright policy."We respond to valid copyright complaints sent to us by a
copyright owner or their authorised representatives," a Twitter spokesman
toldReutersRELATED:Big sign Donald Trump is worriedTrump: Snapchat trying to
'rig election'The three-minute, 45-second video uploaded on Mr Trump's YouTube
channel was tweeted by his campaign on Thursday. The clip, which is still on
YouTube, had garnered more than 60,000 views and 13,000 likes.The
videostreaming platform's parent Google did not immediately respond to a
request for comment.The US President has repeatedly clashed with the social
media platform since it placed a fact check on two of his tweets in which he
madeunsubstantiated claims of mail-in votingTwitter said the tweets violated
its "civic integrity policy", which bars users from "manipulating or
interfering in elections or other civic processes".Last week,another of Mr
Trump's tweets were hidden'He got nasty': General turns on TrumpTwitter is
doing nothing about all of the lies & propaganda being put out by China or the
Radical Left Democrat Party. They have targeted Republicans, Conservatives &
the President of the United States. Section 230 should be revoked by Congress.
Until then, it will be regulated!May 29, 2020"Twitter is doing nothing about
all of the lies & propaganda being put out by China or the Radical Left
Democrat Party," Mr Trump tweeted in response to the social media platform's
move."They have targeted Republicans, Conservatives & the President of the
United States. Section 230 should be revoked by Congress. Until then, it will
be regulated!"Mr Trump has pledged to introduce legislation that may scrap or
weaken a law that shields social media companies from liability for content
posted by their users.- With wiresOriginally published asTwitter disables
Trump's Floyd videoSigned UpView more letters

relations.sentence: Twitter have disabled a George Floyd tribute video, posted by US President Donald Trump's campaign, on its platform, citing a copyright complaint, in the latest clash between the leader and the social media platform.

In widely-circulated footage,former police officer Derek ChauvinTwitter said the video on the President's campaign Twitter account, retweeted by both the President personally and his son, was affected by its copyright policy.

"We respond to valid copyright complaints sent to us by a copyright owner or their authorised representatives," a Twitter spokesman toldReutersRELATED:Big sign Donald Trump is worriedTrump: Snapchat trying to 'rig election'The three-minute, 45-second video uploaded on Mr Trump's YouTube channel was tweeted by his campaign on Thursday.

"We respond to valid copyright complaints sent to us by a copyright owner or their authorised representatives," a Twitter spokesman toldReutersRELATED:Big sign Donald Trump is worriedTrump: Snapchat trying to 'rig election'The three-minute, 45-second video uploaded on Mr Trump's YouTube channel was tweeted by his campaign on Thursday.

The US President has repeatedly clashed with the social media platform since it placed a fact check on two of his tweets in which he madeunsubstantiated claims of mail-in votingTwitter said the tweets violated its "civic integrity policy", which bars users from "manipulating or interfering in elections or other civic processes".
They have targeted Republicans, Conservatives & the President of the United States.
"They have targeted Republicans, Conservatives & the President of the United States.

The US President has repeatedly clashed with the social media platform since it placed a fact check on two of his tweets in which he madeunsubstantiated claims of mail-in votingTwitter said the tweets violated its "civic integrity policy", which bars users from "manipulating or interfering in elections or other civic processes".

The US President has repeatedly clashed with the social media platform since it placed a fact check on two of his tweets in which he madeunsubstantiated claims of mail-in votingTwitter said the tweets violated its "civic integrity policy", which bars users from "manipulating or interfering in elections or other civic processes".

Last week,another of Mr Trump's tweets were hidden'He got nasty': General turns on TrumpTwitter is doing nothing about all of the lies & propaganda being put out by China or the Radical Left Democrat Party.
May 29, 2020"Twitter is doing nothing about all of the lies & propaganda being put out by China or the Radical Left Democrat Party," Mr Trump tweeted in response to the social media platform's move.

Twitter have disabled a George Floyd tribute video, posted by US President Donald Trump's campaign, on its platform, citing a copyright complaint, in the latest clash between the leader and the social media platform.

The clip features Mr Trump speaking, with an overlay of photos and videos of protest marches and instances of violence that have occurred in the aftermath of the 36-year-old's death at the hands of a white police officer in Minneapolis, Minnesota, last week.

title: Twitter disables Trump’s Floyd video [Herald Sun (Melbourne, Australia)]
html: Twitter have disabled a George Floyd tribute video, posted by US President Donald Trump’s campaign, on its platform, citing a copyright complaint, in the latest clash between the leader and the social media platform.The clip features Mr Trump speaking, with an overlay of photos and videos of protest marches and instances of violence that have occurred in the aftermath of the 36-year-old’s death at the hands of a white police officer in Minneapolis, Minnesota, last week.In widely-circulated footage,former police officer Derek ChauvinTwitter said the video on the President’s campaign Twitter account, retweeted by both the President personally and his son, was affected by its copyright policy.“We respond to valid copyright complaints sent to us by a copyright owner or their authorised representatives,” a Twitter spokesman toldReutersRELATED:Big sign Donald Trump is worriedTrump: Snapchat trying to ‘rig election’The three-minute, 45-second video uploaded on Mr Trump’s YouTube channel was tweeted by his campaign on Thursday. The clip, which is still on YouTube, had garnered more than 60,000 views and 13,000 likes.The videostreaming platform’s parent Google did not immediately respond to a request for comment.The US President has repeatedly clashed with the social media platform since it placed a fact check on two of his tweets in which he madeunsubstantiated claims of mail-in votingTwitter said the tweets violated its “civic integrity policy”, which bars users from “manipulating or interfering in elections or other civic processes”.Last week,another of Mr Trump’s tweets were hidden‘He got nasty’: General turns on TrumpTwitter is doing nothing about all of the lies & propaganda being put out by China or the Radical Left Democrat Party. They have targeted Republicans, Conservatives & the President of the United States. Section 230 should be revoked by Congress. Until then, it will be regulated!May 29, 2020“Twitter is doing nothing about all of the lies & propaganda being put out by China or the Radical Left Democrat Party,” Mr Trump tweeted in response to the social media platform’s move.“They have targeted Republicans, Conservatives & the President of the United States. Section 230 should be revoked by Congress. Until then, it will be regulated!”Mr Trump has pledged to introduce legislation that may scrap or weaken a law that shields social media companies from liability for content posted by their users.– With wiresOriginally published asTwitter disables Trump’s Floyd videoSigned UpView more letters
